description:
The second half of SPYxFAMILY.

With Anya Forger successfully enrolled at the renowned Eden Academy, Operation Strix advances to its second phase. To investigate Ostanian politician Donovan Desmond, Anya must either befriend his son Damian or collect eight Stella Stars to become an Imperial Scholar. Fortunately, Anya has already acquired her first star. In celebration, her adoptive father, Loid, decides to fulfill her wish to adopt a dog.

During their canine search, Loid receives new orders from his superiors, who have found that a band of Berlint University students is plotting to assassinate Westalis' Minister Brantz using bombs worn by trained dogs. While Loid tries to stop their plans, Anya stumbles upon the terrorists' base of operations. There, she befriends a kindhearted, clairvoyant dog who the family later names Bond.

Although the Forgers continue to lead their individual lives in secrecy, the family—with a new fluffy addition—remains united through all of the unusual obstacles thrown their way.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)
synonyms: スパイファミリー 2クール

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Espionage
tags.description: Prominently features characters infiltrating an organization in order to steal sensitive information.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Fake Relationship
tags.description: When two characters enter a fake relationship that mutually benefits one or both involved.

tags.name: Parenthood
tags.description: Centers around the experience of raising a child.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Cohabitation
tags.description: Features two or more people who live in the same household and develop a romantic or sexual relationship.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Tennis
tags.description: Centers around the sport of tennis.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/asanovic7) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/asanovic7/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/asanovic7/)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). One of the founding members of [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

Married to [Reiko Sakai](https://anilist.co/staff/148052/).

[Twitter](https://x.com/PJciDsLcfywX1BI?s=20)

Affiliated with [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YuhoTaniuchi)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/122813934)

Originating from Studio Fuga.

Affiliated with [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/USUI_H)

Director of the Background Art Department at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

Wanted to pursue a career in anime after having seen [Princess Mononoke](https://anilist.co/anime/164/) while still in high school. The art depiction of the movie's setting made her want to become a background artist. She entered the industry in 2002, and joined Studio Who, a background art studio ran by [Tsutomu Fujita](https://anilist.co/staff/147331/). Later she joined Studio Easter and worked on many of [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/)' projects, most notably making her debut as an art director on [Idolmaster](https://anilist.co/anime/10278/). She has since served as an art director on [Your Lie in April](https://anilist.co/anime/20665/), [Occultic;Nine](https://anilist.co/anime/21708/), [Horimiya](https://anilist.co/anime/124080/) among others.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/skm2y_1121)

Director of the Photography Department at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

After moving to Tokyo, Sakuma initially joined Azuhata Production, where he gained some experience before joining [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/) in 2009. There he took part in the production of [Welcome to the Space Show](https://anilist.co/anime/8115/), and later made his debut as director of photography on [Saint Onii-san](https://anilist.co/anime/15775/).
She is currently working at MADBOX.
Shouji Hata is an Audio Engineer.
Freelance sound effects creator.

name.native: バンプ・オブ・チキン

node.description: __[Website](https://www.bumpofchicken.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/boc_official_)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/BUMPOFCHICKEN)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/bumpofchickenofficial/)__ __Introduction:__ BUMP OF CHICKEN, alternatively nicknamed バンプ (BUMP), and otherwise abbreviated to BOC (__B__UMP __O__F __C__HICKEN) is a four-piece Japanese rock band under record label TOYS FACTORY (2000-), having previously been under record label HIGHLINE RECORDS (1998-2000). Since their formation back in 1994, they have released eight albums and twenty-three singles. Their releases through the time became quite popular in Japan, seeing as every release since their third single, "Tentai Kansoku", has managed to reach the top ten in the Oricon Weekly Charts. Their music has also been used in various video games and as theme thongs for movies, television shows and anime. The band's name has its initial meaning from 弱者の反撃 (which when translated means _counterattack of the weak_). __Biography:__ "Let's form a band and change the history of rock.", suggested 14 years old Hideo Masu to classmate and friend Motoo Fujiwara during their 2nd year at West Usai Junior High in 1994. Along with the two other childhood friends, Hiroaki Masukawa (g) and Yoshifumi Naoi (ba), they saved up their money to buy instruments; Fujiwara even says he saved up his lunch money instead of using it to buy food. However, due to his strict parents, Fujiwara asked Masukawa if he could hide his guitar at his house instead of bringing it home. Their first performance was in 1994, during their ninth grade cultural festival, where they would play a cover of The Beatles' version of "Twist and Shout". At first they just played covers like this, but later they began writing their own songs that were in English. In 1996, their song "Danny" won a prize on 96TFM. They were only 17 years old at the time. In the same year they also won more awards with the song "Glass no Blues" and even released a demo tape during a live performance in 1997, which sold out in a whopping 10 minutes. The band, however, was put on hold while the members attended college... BUMP OF CHICKEN resumed activities in 1998, and in the year 1999 they released their first album, "Flame Vein". They also released their first single, "Lamp", later on in the same year. In the year 2000, the band saw their first promotional video for "Glorious Revolution", and the release of their second album "The Living Dead", as well as the release of their second single "Diamond". This was also the year that they did their first tour. In the year 2001, their popularity was on the rise with the release of their third single "Tentai Kansoku". This song caught the attention of the public, becoming an incredibly popular song. Their third album titled "Jupiter", released the following year, enjoyed good sales from this new popularity. In the following years came more live tours, more singles, and then came 2004. On August 25th 2004, Bump of Chicken proudly released their fourth album, Yggdrasil. Interestingly enough, Fujiwara himself did the album art for this CD, as he did with The Living Dead. The song Sailing Day, featured on this album, was used in the anime movie One Piece Movie 4: Dead End Adventure. (Contination of their biography can be read here: [wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bump_of_Chicken)) __Members:__ [Motoo Fujiwara](https://anilist.co/staff/103926/Motoo-Fujiwara) （藤原基央） Motoo Fujiwara "FujiKun" is the composer, lyricist, guitar, and main vocalist of the group. He has written most of the music, and has also drawn the artwork for their albums 'The Living Dead' and 'Yggdrasil'. Hiroaki Masukawa （増川弘明） Hiroaki Masukawa "Hiro" is the guitarist of the group, and also writes most of the hidden joke tracks for albums. He is referred to as the shy member of the group, and calls himself pessimistic. Yoshifumi Naoi （直井由文） Yoshifumi Naoi is the bassist of the group, and is referred to as the "crowd pleaser". Also known as Chama. He jokes that he "falls ill exactly four times a year." He also calls himself an anime and game otaku, and a "rare genius". Hideo Masu （升秀夫） Hideo Masu is the drummer for the band. He describes himself as an introvert. He also mentions that he has good eyesight, cannot write kanji well, likes to go outdoors, and often gets headaches. (Sources: [Wikipedia (EN)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bump_of_Chicken), edited | [JMusicAmerica (archived)](https://web.archive.org/web/20071221233334/http://www.jmusicamerica.com/us/database-artist.php?id=153#), edited)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/douhwe) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ya.ma_00/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UClbieOB_NYcY9TlIthmyw-A) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@yama_official_tiktok)__

__Introduction:__
yama is a Japanese vocalist affiliated with the record label MASTERSIX FOUNDATION (2020–). They have been active since 2018, but didn't make their debut before November 2019, where they appeared as a guest vocalist on the song "[Nemuru Machi](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ePBjUMEeqBw)", produced by vocaloid producer [Kujira](https://twitter.com/WhaleDontSleep).

__Biography:__
After their initial debut, yama wouldn't reappear before later on April 17, 2020, where they released their first original song titled "[Haru wo Tsugeru](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DC6JppqHkaM)". Later in the same year on October 21, they made their major debut with the song "[Masshiro](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lj64XpVS7dk)" through the record label MASTERSIX FOUNDATION.

Close to the end of 2020, on December 18, yama made their first physical appearance on the channel 'THE FIRST TAKE', performing their song Haru wo Tsugeru.

At the beginning of 2021, yama made their first appearance in anime with the song "[Mahi](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2By3feOVw20)", which was used as the opening theme song to the anime 2.43: Seiin High School Boys Volleyball Team. The song is their first CD single, which released on February 10, 2021.

__[Website](https://www.whaledontsleep.tokyo) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/WhaleDontSleep) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/whaledontsleep) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC2r-wVWZXY-ClUPanhPe8_w) | [FANBOX](https://whale0302.fanbox.cc/)__

__Introduction:__
Kujira, also known as Whale Don't Sleep, is a Japanese singer, lyricist, composer, arranger and Vocaloid Producer.

__Biography:__
He started his activities on April 1, 2019.
Kujira writes lyrics, composes, and arranges all of his own music, and has been actively releasing works using VOCALOID, vocal feat. works by [yama](https://anilist.co/staff/203751/yama), [Ado](https://anilist.co/staff/244242/Ado), and others, as well as providing music to the world.
In July 2019, he released a VOCALOID album titled "Nemuru Machi".
In October 2020, he released an album of mainly features and VOCALOIDs titled "Nerenai Yoru ni Curtain o Akete".
In August 2022, he release his first album sung by himself, called "Seikatsu o Aiseru you ni Naru Made".

__[Website](https://www.whaledontsleep.tokyo) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/WhaleDontSleep) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/whaledontsleep) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC2r-wVWZXY-ClUPanhPe8_w) | [FANBOX](https://whale0302.fanbox.cc/)__

__Introduction:__
Kujira, also known as Whale Don't Sleep, is a Japanese singer, lyricist, composer, arranger and Vocaloid Producer.

__Biography:__
He started his activities on April 1, 2019.
Kujira writes lyrics, composes, and arranges all of his own music, and has been actively releasing works using VOCALOID, vocal feat. works by [yama](https://anilist.co/staff/203751/yama), [Ado](https://anilist.co/staff/244242/Ado), and others, as well as providing music to the world.
In July 2019, he released a VOCALOID album titled "Nemuru Machi".
In October 2020, he released an album of mainly features and VOCALOIDs titled "Nerenai Yoru ni Curtain o Akete".
In August 2022, he release his first album sung by himself, called "Seikatsu o Aiseru you ni Naru Made".
